p: A total of 60 cases were identified from 1955 through 2007 in Bolivia. In the first instance, Uruma virus, now considered to be a strain of Mayaro, was isolated from the blood of two febrile Okinawan colonists in 1955 ( 15). Another article reported that 12 cases of MAYV were found in 2007, but no further information was provided about the cases ( 14). The remaining 46 MAYV cases in Bolivia were identified from 2000 to 2007 in a study done in three departments of the country ( 16).
